item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, May 9, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. ALICE detects the conversion of lead into gold at the LHC (307 points | 178 comments)
2. In the Network of the Conclav: How we "guessed" the Pope using network science (48 points | 25 comments)
3. Launch HN: Nao Labs (YC X25) – Cursor for Data (58 points | 26 comments)
4. Past, present, and future of Sorbet type syntax (66 points | 26 comments)
5. Sofie: open-source web based system for automating live TV news production (193 points | 27 comments)
6. 21 GB/s CSV Parsing Using SIMD on AMD 9950X (180 points | 76 comments)
7. Show HN: A backend agnostic Ruby framework for building reactive desktop apps (41 points | 17 comments)
8. Itter.sh – Micro-Blogging via Terminal (118 points | 36 comments)
9. Show HN: BlenderQ – A TUI for managing multiple Blender renders (32 points | 4 comments)
10. Rollstack (YC W23) Is Hiring TypeScript Engineers (Remote US/CA) ( | hide)
11. New Tool: lsds – List All Linux Block Devices and Settings in One Place (13 points | discuss)
12. Show HN: Oliphaunt – A native Mastodon client for macOS (38 points | 13 comments)
13. LegoGPT: Generating Physically Stable and Buildable Lego (509 points | 131 comments)
14. How Warren Robinett Made Adventure on the Atari (4 points | discuss)
15. Show HN: Hyvector – A fast and modern SVG editor (202 points | 44 comments)
16. Show HN: Aberdeen – An elegant approach to reactive UIs (141 points | 77 comments)
17. CryptPad: An Alternative to the Google Suite (100 points | 30 comments)
18. Show HN: Hydra (YC W22) – Serverless Analytics on Postgres (27 points | 11 comments)
19. Cell Mates: Extracting Useful Information from Tables for LLMs (12 points | 1 comment)
20. The Anarchitecture Group (19 points | 2 comments)
21. Data manipulations alleged in study that paved way for Microsoft's quantum chip (157 points | 112 comments)
22. The birth of AI poker? Letters from the 1984 WSOP (32 points | 4 comments)
23. Implementing a Struct of Arrays (96 points | 32 comments)
24. NSF faces shake-up as officials abolish its 37 divisions (320 points | 411 comments)
25. Former Supreme Court justice David Souter has died (68 points | 26 comments)
26. A Taxonomy for Rendering Engines (34 points | 12 comments)
27. The CL1: the first code deployable biological computer (27 points | 11 comments)
28. Show HN: Agents.erl (AI Agents in Erlang) (22 points | 10 comments)
29. Hollow Core Fiber (HCF) (43 points | 20 comments)
30. The Linux Kernel's PGP Web of Trust (65 points | 11 comments)
